# AXChart

**Protocol**

A protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary for an accessibility element to act as a chart.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol AXChart : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

Use this protocol when you want to create an accessible representation of a chart — a view that displays a graphical representation of a data set — for VoiceOver to play as an audio graph.

Adopt the [doc://com.apple.Accessibility/documentation/Accessibility/AXChart] protocol on your chart’s view model, and set the [doc://com.apple.Accessibility/documentation/Accessibility/AXChart/accessibilityChartDescriptor] property to an [doc://com.apple.Accessibility/documentation/Accessibility/AXChartDescriptor] that contains all the semantic information you need to represent your chart through an audio interface, like the chart’s title, axes, data points, and a summary of the chart’s key takeaways.

## Supporting accessibility

- **accessibilityChartDescriptor**: A semantic description of an accessible chart or graph in the form of a chart descriptor.
- **AXChartDescriptor**: An object that contains all the semantic information about an accessible chart.

## Chart representation

- **AXChartDescriptor**: An object that contains all the semantic information about an accessible chart.
